entry.title: YTD v4.3.1
entry.content:
YouTube Downloader version 4.3.1 is available!
As always, download it from this blog or wait until will be available also through the selected app stores (see the app’s page).

Changelog:

 v4.3.1 - Jul 16 2014
-----------------------------------
[x] encrypted signature patch (9) (thanks Rahul Verma)
[x] setting to download beta updates

entry.title: New Beta Program (Again)
entry.content:
Seeing the extremely low “XDA acceptance ratio” of the latest beta distribution method, :–) I’m in the process to move from the Crashlytics distribution to an open method where beta versions will be available from the app itself.

Will be just a matter of switching a setting checkbox:

Please wait for a next update (v4.3.1) to have this feature.

entry.title: YTD v4.4 Beta-3 and 4
entry.content:
Changelog for YTD v4.4 beta-3 and 4, available through Crashlytics Beta: (no more: see next post).

 v4.4 beta-3
-----------------------------------
[x] configurable downloads queue
[x] option to invert dashboard's entries click menus
[x] auto-resume downloads paused due to network failure
[x] new FFmpeg build targeting non-NEON CPUs (i.e. Tegra devices)
[x] ability to send logcat to the developer via email

(since beta-4)
[x] added Croatian (almost completed) and Indonesian (partial) translations
[x] fixed dashboard rename with existing filename (thanks m0d)

Please see the preceding post for further details about this beta program.

entry.title: Beta by Crashlytics
entry.content:
The informations below are no more valid. See …

I’m launching a new closed beta program for YouTube Downloader It has been developed by Crashlytics; they are the same smart guys that build the library I use in YTD to report errors and force-close events. It’s really well done and functional: I can deploy new builds addressing specific issues directly to the beta testers and I can release frequently new versions, because all is integrated into the development environment. Other than that, as all their site and UIs in general, it looks awesome.

Basically, this is how it works:

  • who’s interested can send me a PM on XDA with his/her email address (or a direct mail, if you already know it [hint: PayPal];
  • I’ll send the invitation to this address (unless the necessary number, type, etc. of testers has been reach);
  • you open the email and follow the instructions to install the “Beta” app; it’s not a YTD beta, but an app by Crashlytics that works as dashboard to launch all the beta apps you are subscribed to; including YTD.

entry.title: YTD v4.4 Beta-2
entry.content: A new beta fixes the bug for the “Auto” default entry for the preference “simultaneous downloads” and adds some more (hidden) optimizations. [Download link removed – old beta].
